p: Most pediatric patients had mild symptoms, without fever or pneumonia. They had good prognosis and recovered within 1–2 weeks after disease onset. Only a few patients had lower respiratory tract infections. Although no severe cases or deaths have been reported in the pediatric population up to now, the potential risk of death should be highlighted. During severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and the Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) epidemics, ARDS and death also occur in pediatric cases [ 2– 4]. The current clinical features are defined only based on the 28 pediatric patients. Clinical features in pediatric patients will be further defined with increased number of confirmed patients.
